item.title: Ticket #578 (Links cannot be edited) updated
item.dc:creator: deadscan
item.description:
Hello,

I tried to reproduce the problem and re-upgraded to 1.2.2 (using the 1.2.2-files and browsing to /upgrade.php). The problem occured again. I checked everything you described above. IÂ´ve checked wp-settings.php from 1.2.2 on my server and it wasnÂ´t corrupt. I also checked the wp-config.php -> everything was ok.

I found out how to "remove" the problem: Using the file /wp-admin/link-manager.php from version 1.2.1 !

It seems, there is a problem with the file link-manager.php after upgrading from 1.2.1 to 1.2.2 . Please tell me, what iÂ´m doing wrong. It works, if i use the link-manager.php from 1.2.1 - and it works not, if i use the standard link-manager.php from 1.2.2 . I upgraded like described and I have checked it several times.

WhatÂ´s wrong with my installation?

item.title: Ticket #585 (Minor FireFOx incompatibility) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
The line <form action="<?php echo get_settings('siteurl'); ?>/wp-comments-post.php" method="post" id="commentform"> is not compatible with FireFox. It should be <form action="<?php echo get_settings('siteurl'); ?>/wp-comments-post.php" method="post" id="commentform" name="commentform">

The âidâ attribute is used by IE, the ânameâ by Mozilla browsers. WordPress failed to set the ânameâ attribute on the form. It worked as as submitted since the ânameâ is not required, but without it, it couldnât be recognized by javascript in FireFox as the element belonging to that label.

This is in the file 'wp-comments.php'. A similar error exists in 'wp_admin/edit-form.php', 'wp-admin/edit-form-advanced.php' and 'wp-admin/edit-form-comment.php'.

Found by the programmer at ​http://SpelChek.com

item.title: Ticket #582 (RSS feeds only send a 304 if the If-Modified-Since header matches exactly.) updated
item.dc:creator: jowilson

item.title: Ticket #582 (RSS feeds only send a 304 if the If-Modified-Since header matches exactly.) created
item.dc:creator: jowilson
item.description:
Bug: When fetching an RSS feed, if I pass in an arbitrary valid date in the If-Modified-Since header which is later than the most recent post time, Wordpress still sends the full feed.

Expected behavior: I should get a 304: not modified response from Wordpress if the If-Modified-Since time is equal to <strong>or greater than</strong> the most recent post time.

Versions affected: 1.2, 1.2.1, 1.2.2, and probably 1.3.

item.title: Ticket #581 (RSS feeds always send the full text of the feed, even on a 304.) updated
item.dc:creator: jowilson
item.description:
Perhaps I should include some information about my configuration.

Server: Apache/1.3.33 (Unix) PHP/4.3.10 mod_ssl/2.8.22 OpenSSL/0.9.6c PHP version: PHP/4.3.10 Wordpress version 1.2.2

item.title: Ticket #581 (RSS feeds always send the full text of the feed, even on a 304.) updated
item.dc:creator: jowilson

item.title: Ticket #581 (RSS feeds always send the full text of the feed, even on a 304.) created
item.dc:creator: jowilson
item.description:
Bug: Wordpress sends back a 304: Not Modified header if the RSS feed has not changed since the client asked for it. But, it then proceeds to send the full text of the whole feed over the connection anyway.

Expected behavior: To receive only a 304 header if the feed has not changed.

Versions: This bug is present in 1.2, 1.2.1, and 1.2.2, and possibly others.
